creator: mnelson@level1.com
text:
There appears to be a bug in $TOMCAT_HOME/bin/tomcat.sh, at line 107.

You'll notice that the indents get goofed up inside the else clause -- but more 
significantly, when NEW_LOADER is turned on, then the configuration in 
~/.tomcatrc does not get picked up (through $oldCP).

At line 129 and 135, you will see the two fi statements at the same indent-
level.  I think the fi at line 135 needs to be moved up.  How far up, depends 
on what behavior the author had in mind when NEW_LOADER is enabled.

Thanks,
Mark

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Thanks, Mark. I removed the "NEW_LOADER" hack completely, it was there to
provide a "backup" in case the class loader changes created any problems. So
 far it seems to work great, and if someone wants to use a different mechansim
( like the old "add all jars to CP using .sh/bat instead of java" ) - it can 
be done in a different script.

Please review the new tomcat.sh, and let us know if we can do any other
simplification. The goal would be to keep the platform-dependent scripts at 
minimum and do as much as possible in java.
